com.github.codeteapot.tools.packer

Interface PackerMessage


  • public interface PackerMessage
    Message of Packer output.
    See Also:
    PackerTerminal.receive(PackerMessage)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DATA_ARTIFACT_BUILDER_ID
      Artifact builder-id key.
      static String DATA_ARTIFACT_END
      Artifact end key.
      static String DATA_ARTIFACT_FILES_COUNT
      Artifact files-count key.
      static String DATA_ARTIFACT_ID
      Artifact id key.
      static String DATA_ARTIFACT_STRING
      Artifact string key.
      static String DATA_UI_ERROR
      Reserved for errors.
      static String DATA_UI_MESSAGE
      Used for basic updates during the build process.
      static String DATA_UI_SAY
      Normally used for announcements about beginning new steps in the build process.
      static String TYPE_ARTIFACT
      Tells information about Packer created during this build.
      static String TYPE_ARTIFACT_COUNT
      Tells how many artifacts a particular build produced.
      static String TYPE_UI
      Means that the information being provided is a human-readable string.
      static String TYPE_VERSION
      What version of Packer is running.
      static String TYPE_VERSION_COMMIT
      The git hash for the commit that the branch of Packer is currently on; most useful for Packer developers.
      static String TYPE_VERSION_PRERELEASE
      Data will contain dev if version is prerelease, and otherwise will be blank.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Values associated with the type.

      When build command is executed this can be either empty or individual build names.
      Instant getTimestamp()
      The timestamp of when message was printed.
      String getType()
      The type of message being outputted.

    • Field Detail

      • TYPE_UI

        static final String TYPE_UI
        Means that the information being provided is a human-readable string.

        There are three data subtypes:

        • DATA_UI_SAY
        • DATA_UI_MESSAGE
        • DATA_UI_ERROR
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_ARTIFACT_COUNT

        static final String TYPE_ARTIFACT_COUNT
        Tells how many artifacts a particular build produced.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_ARTIFACT

        static final String TYPE_ARTIFACT
        Tells information about Packer created during this build.

        There are three data entry fields for each message.

        0
        artifact_number
        1
        key
        2
        value

        There are five available field keys for each artifact.

        • DATA_ARTIFACT_BUILDER_ID
        • DATA_ARTIFACT_ID
        • DATA_ARTIFACT_STRING
        • DATA_ARTIFACT_FILES_COUNT
        • DATA_ARTIFACT_END
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_VERSION

        static final String TYPE_VERSION
        What version of Packer is running.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_VERSION_PRERELEASE

        static final String TYPE_VERSION_PRERELEASE
        Data will contain dev if version is prerelease, and otherwise will be blank.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_VERSION_COMMIT

        static final String TYPE_VERSION_COMMIT
        The git hash for the commit that the branch of Packer is currently on; most useful for Packer developers.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_UI_SAY

        static final String DATA_UI_SAY
        Normally used for announcements about beginning new steps in the build process.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_UI_MESSAGE

        static final String DATA_UI_MESSAGE
        Used for basic updates during the build process.
        See Also:

        static final String DATA_UI_ERROR
        Reserved for errors.

    • Method Detail

      • getTimestamp

        Instant getTimestamp()
        The timestamp of when message was printed.
        Returns:
        The message timestamp value.

      • getTarget

        Optional<String> getTarget()
        When build command is executed this can be either empty or individual build names.

        It is normally empty when builds are in progress, and the build name when artifacts of particular builds are being referred to.

        Returns:
        The target on build command, that can be empty.

      • getType

        String getType()
        The type of message being outputted.
        Returns:
        The type of the message.

      • getData

        String[] getData()
        Values associated with the type.

        The exact amount and meaning of this data is type-dependent.

        Returns:
        Those values associated with the type.
